answers.answer: Nope but I hope maybe u are just carrying different or the baby is bigger,or that you are farther than expected rather than having  diabetes,extra  amniotic fluid,twins etc....
Oh man...i hope i dont have gestational diabetes...I just got that test done today.
Is it possible to have twins and not know it this far along?

Ive been measuring bigger than I'm supposed to the last 2 times I went to see the doctor. My gestational diabetes test came back all normal so she doesn't know why I'm measuring bigger. She said she'll keep an eye on it. I must have a big baby.

At 21 wks my uterus was suppose to be 2.5cm above my navel but was under my ribs already, I had too much amniotic fluid but that's now resolved spontaneously... I failed the 1 hr glucose but passed the 2 hr
Good to know it may not be the gestational diabetes. Yeah i wonder if I'll have a big baby. Which my other two were 7lb8oz and 7lb13oz so idk...
@C0rruptted did your baby measure big at your ultrasound?

This is how I was with my first. No gestational diabetes or anything else..she was just a big baby! She was 9 lbs!  How big were you and your significant other? If you were 8 lbs or bigger expect to most likely have a big baby. You'll be fine regardless :)

I was a small baby, 6lb 5oz (i was even 2 weeks late). My hubby was 9lb 5oz so i guess its possible that its just a big baby. It just seems crazy cause our other two were 7.5lb roughly. Im scared to have a big baby cause im a very small person...no hips either. But as long as shes healthy i cant complain.

I had the opposite problem. I was measuring to small. I am 27 weeks and have lost 16 lbs since being pregnant. Thankfully i have gained three back. I think everyone is different. Could be checking for multiples too.

Well I haven't had an ultrasound since 19 weeks and baby was average size. But it wasn't until I was 24 weeks that I started measuring bigger. I'm now almost 28 weeks and as I said, last 2 checkups I was bigger. I'm sure if it doesn't even out in the coming weeks my doctor would want an ultrasound done to look into it further. Let me know how your ultrasound goes and if it's large baby or extra fluid or something else :)
I have had an ultrasound every 4 weeks. My last was on 25 Feb and my baby is larger than she should be. I am also carrying a lot of fluid. Don't worry about it to much though.
Thanks ladies, I feel better now and I'm going to try not to worry. C0rruptted, ill let you know what they say at the ultrasound.

With my first pregnancy I was measuring big, and well my baby boy came out weighing a whopping 11lbs12oz! My second pregnancy was a girl weighing 10lbs10 1/2oz. I am hoping to grow this boy smaller if he is like 9lbs i will feel like I have a premie! Lol but not likely to happen as he is already measuring big.
Wow those are some big babies! Youre a brave woman.
Wow! I really don't want my baby that big. This is my first so I kinda want an easy labour. Lol.

question: Anyone else have an ultrasound done because they stomach was measuring larger than normal? I was just at the doctor and he scheduled me for an ultrasound at my next appt. cause I'm measuring larger than normal for how far i am. I asked him any reasons why that might be and he said that i just might be carrying different or the baby is bigger but said he just didnt want to overlook anything...whatever that means. Anyone have experience with this?
title: Ultrasound for larger than normal stomach measurement
